org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as

Class BaseRawTokenizer<T extends TokenBase>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as.BaseRawTokenizer<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseRawASTokenizer

    public abstract class BaseRawTokenizer<T extends TokenBase>
extends Object
    Base class for JFlex-based tokenizers (RawScriptTokenizer, RawTagTokenizer, RawCSSTokenizer, RawMetadataTokenizer). Tokenizers should use %extends BaseRawTokenizer and provide a definitino for getColumn(). yytext()) will be generated automatically.

    • Method Detail

      • initTokenPool

        protected abstract T[] initTokenPool()

      • yytext

        protected abstract String yytext()
        Gets the text of the current token. This is implemented by JFlex.
        Returns:
        The text of current token

      • getSourcePath

        public String getSourcePath()
        Gets the source path for the file being tokenized. This source path is used when reporting problems.

      • setSourcePath

        public void setSourcePath(String sourcePath)
        Sets the source path for the file being tokenized. This source path is used when reporting problems.

      • getOffset

        protected abstract int getOffset()
        Gets the current offset of the tokenizer into the file buffer. This should be implemented in the grammar file by returning JFlex's zzchar.
        Returns:
        The current offset.

      • getLine

        protected abstract int getLine()
        Gets the current line number of the tokenizer. Lines numbers start at 0, not 1. This should be implemented in the grammar file by returning JFlex's zzline.
        Returns:
        The current line.

      • getColumn

        protected abstract int getColumn()
        Gets the current column number of the tokenizer. Column numbers start at 0, not 1. This should be implemented in the grammar file by returning JFlex's zzcolumn.
        Returns:
        The current column.

        protected final ISourceLocation getCurrentSourceLocation(int tokenLength)
        Create a ISourceLocation object based on the current lexer state.
        Parameters:
        tokenLength - Length of the problematic input.
        Returns:
        Current source location used to report a syntax problem.

        Returns:

      • fetchToken

        protected final T fetchToken(int type,
           int start,
           int end,
           int line,
           int column,
           CharSequence text)
        Builds a token, or reuses a token, based on the underlying token pool
        Parameters:
        type - the type of token to build
        start - the token start
        end - the token end
        line - the token line
        column - the token column
        text - the token text
        Returns:
        a token from the passed in parameters. This token is not safe to hold on to, and should be used and discarded before further tokens are queried

      • newToken

        protected abstract T newToken(int type,
         int start,
         int end,
         int line,
         int column,
         CharSequence text)

      • buildAggregateToken

        public T buildAggregateToken(int type)
        Build a token from the current aggregated text and the given type
        Parameters:
        type - token type (based on the appropriate XxxTokenTypes interface)
        Returns:
        new token

      • buildToken

        public final T buildToken(int type)
        Builds a token with the specified type and text, using the current getOffset(), getLine(), and getColumn(). The grammar file should not override this.
        Parameters:
        type - token type (based on the appropriate XxxTokenTypes interface)
        Returns:
        new token

      • buildToken

        public T buildToken(int type,
           String text)
        Build a token of the specified type, using the current yytext(), getOffset(), getLine(), and getColumn(). The grammar file cannot override this.
        Parameters:
        type - token type (based on the appropriate XxxTokenTypes interface)
        Returns:
        new token

      • getContext

        protected String getContext(int line)
        Get the current context as a string (to help with debugging)
        Parameters:
        line - current line number
        Returns:
        description of current context
